name: Caspian Sea
hint: The world's largest enclosed inland body of water, bordered by five countries

name: Baikal
hint: The world's deepest and oldest freshwater lake, located in Siberia, Russia

name: Aral Sea
hint: Once the fourth-largest lake in the world, this Central Asian lake has dramatically shrunk since the 1960s

name: Balkhash
hint: A large lake in southeastern Kazakhstan, unique for having both fresh and salt water halves

name: Tonle Sap
hint: Southeast Asia's largest freshwater lake, located in Cambodia, connected to the Mekong River

name: Dead Sea
hint: A salt lake bordered by Jordan and Israel, the lowest point on Earth's surface

name: Lake Urmia
hint: A large saline lake in northwestern Iran, one of the largest saltwater lakes in the Middle East

name: Qinghai Lake
hint: The largest lake in China, a saline lake on the Tibetan Plateau in Qinghai province
